Protocols/CardModal_NavigationController.name: isDraggingEnabled
Protocols/CardModal_NavigationController.abstract: If the dragging is enabled. You might want to disable this when swiping to a new controller.

Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.name: cardModalWillDrag(_:to:)
Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.abstract: Called when the MMMCardModal will drag to a new stickPosition.

Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.name: cardModalIsDragging(_:to:progress:)
Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.abstract: Called while the MMMCardModal is dragging to a new stickPosition, so you can animate with the progress.

Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.name: cardModalDidDrag(_:to:)
Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.abstract: Called when the MMMCardModal did drag to a new stickPosition.

Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.name: cardModalWillDragToClose(_:)
Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.abstract: Called when the MMMCardModal will drag to close. Use this to dismiss the presented viewController.

Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.name: cardModalDidDragToClose(_:)
Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.abstract: Called when the MMMCardModal did drag to close.

Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.name: cardModalDidTapOutside(_:)
Protocols/CardModal_PresentationProtocol.abstract: Called when the MMMCardModal did tap outside of the presented card.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/SnapshotPolic.name: default
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/SnapshotPolic.abstract: We only take a snapshot once, before presenting the modal, and one right before dismisssing.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/SnapshotPolic.name: lowPriority
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/SnapshotPolic.abstract: We take snapshots with low priority, this equals to every 5 seconds, and right before dismissing. Use

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/SnapshotPolic.name: highPriority
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/SnapshotPolic.abstract: We take snapshots with high priority, this equals to every second, and right befoire dismisssing. Use

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/AnimationType.name: constraints
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/AnimationType.abstract: We animate the constraints, this resizes the CardView; your constraints should be ready for this.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/AnimationCons.name: speed
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/AnimationCons.abstract: Animation speed, defaults to 1. This is used as a multiplier.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/AnimationCons.name: threshold
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/AnimationCons.abstract: Only start the animation after this threshold is met. From 0 to 1, defaults to 0. This is

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/AnimationCons.name: clamp
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options/AnimationCons.abstract: If the value should be clamped to max at to.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/isScale.name: isScaleEffectEnabled
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/isScale.abstract: If the presenting viewController (snapshot thereof) should be scaled

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/isFadeE.name: isFadeEffectEnabled
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/isFadeE.abstract: If the presenting viewController (snapshot thereof) should be faded

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/topPadd.name: topPadding
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/topPadd.abstract: The amount of space from the top of the screen to the modal.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/backgro.name: backgroundColor
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/backgro.abstract: The background color behind the snapshot of the presenting viewController.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/cardCor.name: cardCornerRadius
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/cardCor.abstract: The cornerRadius of the card where the presented viewController lives.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/cardBac.name: cardBackgroundColor
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/cardBac.abstract: The backgroundColor of the card where the presented viewController lives.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/dragVel.name: dragVelocity
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/dragVel.abstract: The amount of velocity it takes to stick to the next StickPosition.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/closeVe.name: closeVelocity
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/closeVe.abstract: The amount of velocity it takes to close.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/capture.name: captureScrollViewVelocityDivision
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/capture.abstract: The amount to divide the velocity by when it comes from a captured scrollview, UIScrollViews have a tendency to pass

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/dragRes.name: dragResistance
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/dragRes.abstract: The resistance when the card is dragged up too far.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationType
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: The policy for updating the constraints, if your view has constraints set to the bottom layout guide this can cause unwanted

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationDuration
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: The duration of the complete animation, in seconds. Defaults to 0.5 seconds.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationDamping
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: The damping applied to the animation spring, in seconds. Defaults to 0.7.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationVelocity
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: The velocity of to the animation spring. Defaults to 0.7.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationAlpha
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: The maximum amount the presenting viewController will be faded out,

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationScale
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: The maximum amount the presenting viewController will be scaled,

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationTransform
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: The maximum amount the presenting viewController will be transformed,

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationTransformToSafeArea
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: If the animationTransform should respect the safeArea.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.name: animationCornerRadius
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animati.abstract: The maximum amount of the cornerRadius applied to the presenting viewController,

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animate.name: animateAfterOrientationChange
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/animate.abstract: If the modal should animate back to it’s stickPosition after an orientation change, or if this

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/alterna.name: alternativeSnapshotView
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/alterna.abstract: Alternative view to take the snapshot from, e.g. for when the presenting viewController

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/snapsho.name: snapshotPolicy
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/snapsho.abstract: How we should take snapshots. See documeentation in SnapshotPolicy for more info on each case.

Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/init(bl.name: init(block:)
Enums/MMMCardModal/Options.html#/init(bl.abstract: Initialize new Options object with a callback to set the required options.

Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.name: captureScrollView
Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.abstract: Assign to a scrollView to have the iOS 13 modal effect of dragging down.

Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.name: captureScrollViewContent
Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.abstract: The view that holds the content insinde the scrollView. It’s reccomended to assign this as well so the user doesn’t notice the

Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.name: stickPositions
Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.abstract: The positions where the CardModal should stick to. Defaults to .top.

Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.name: isDraggingEnabled
Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.abstract: If the drag recognizer is enabled, disable this to stop listening to drag events.

Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.name: close(animated:)
Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.abstract: Set controller to ‘closed’ state, please note that you will still have to call dismiss().

Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.name: askForSnapshot()
Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html#.abstract: The implementation can ask for a new snapshot from the presenting controller, e.g. when presenting as a

Enums/MMMCardModal/StickPosition.html#/t.name: top
Enums/MMMCardModal/StickPosition.html#/t.abstract: The top of the screen, below the safeArea and with normalPadding applied. Same as .percentage(0).

Enums/MMMCardModal/StickPosition.html#/c.name: center
Enums/MMMCardModal/StickPosition.html#/c.abstract: The center of the screen. Same as .percentage(0.5).

Enums/MMMCardModal/StickPosition.html#/p.name: points(_:)
Enums/MMMCardModal/StickPosition.html#/p.abstract: Amount in points to stick at, from the bottom.

Enums/MMMCardModal/StickPosition.html#/p.name: percentage(_:)
Enums/MMMCardModal/StickPosition.html#/p.abstract: Percentage of screen to stick at, e.g. 0.3 = 30% from the top.

Enums/MMMCardModal.html#/ViewController.name: ViewController
Enums/MMMCardModal.html#/ViewController.abstract: Subclass the ViewController for a single modal, if you need navigation, look

Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html.name: _ViewController
Enums/MMMCardModal/_ViewController.html.abstract: Don’t use this class directly, use the MMMCardModal.ViewController instead.

Enums/MMMCardModal.html#/ChildController.name: ChildControllerDelegate
Enums/MMMCardModal.html#/ChildController.abstract: Conform the ViewControllers in your NavigationController to this delegate to get a reference to

Enums/MMMCardModal.html#/NavigationContr.name: NavigationController
Enums/MMMCardModal.html#/NavigationContr.abstract: If you have a custom NavigationController, you can conform to this protocol.

Enums/MMMCardModal/NavigationHost.html.name: NavigationHost
Enums/MMMCardModal/NavigationHost.html.abstract: Present a set of ViewControllers in a MMMCardModal.

Enums/MMMCardModal.html.name: MMMCardModal
Enums/MMMCardModal.html.abstract: iOS 13 like card modals that support multiple positions on screen, just like Apple Maps.
